message:
Hello geeks, I am learning TDD and I have a question here in stackoverflow if you would help me I would be grateful
Thank you.
story: Muhammad Sabry Abdulwanis shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: How to write similar test cases without breaking the simple responsibility principle?
caption: stackoverflow.com
description: I have a unit Test where I want to test different input and make sure the output is correct. I created a Unit test for all of the test cases as follow [TestMethod] public void CountInversion...

data.message:
المشكلة ف ده لو ال Test هيـ Fail مش هتعرف المشكلة كانت ف ف اي input.
ممكن طلاما هو هو نفس ال Test بس بـ Inputs مختلفة تعمل Test Case ،  فبدل ده كله هيبقى شكله حاجة زي كده بـ NUnit
http://codepaste.net/anco2y
Use xunit.net framework to solve the parameters issues it is used by asp.net team as I know and don't use more than one assert per test
